description: The majestic Columbine (Aquilegia olympica) is an amazing species of wildflower native to the American Pacific Northwest. Noted for its unique beauty and distinct shape, it is found in a variety of colors — from purple to blue to white — and its long-stemmed blooms are covered in delicate petals that form a striking starburst shape. Its signature bell-shaped flowers also attract hummingbirds, butterflies, and other pollinators. In addition to being beautiful, the Columbine is hardy and can thrive in many soil and weather conditions. Its resilience makes it an ideal choice for gardens where it can add eye-catching color year after year.
